intro: Achillea maura, commonly known as yellow archangel, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features basal rosettes of finely divided, dark green leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers in early summer. The plant is characterized by its aromatic foliage and is often found in moist, shady environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its name is derived from the Greek myth of Achilles and his nurse, who used the plant to treat wounds.
